Articles.Content:
2,001: A space odyssey

Floor 4990: You see Jool from HVO. (High Vall Orbit)

Edited September 23, 2018 by Pascovian

floor 4991: you see a person desperately trying to code a good kopernicus mod for ksp and yet failing and constantly asking questions online to people who are way better and probably think that what he's asking sounds kinda dumb, and you go up to the next floor.

Edited October 9, 2018 by electricpants
Floor 4992: this room is very long, you see some directors setting up the credits scene for A Hat in Time.
Floor 4993: a portal to Floor 4994.
Floor 4994 is pretty slick. You slide down to 4995,

Floor 4996 is not only a floor of sight and sound, but of mind.

Edited October 14, 2018 by Kernel Kraken
Floor 4997 is a dimly lit room with a console showing a city on the screen above and a moderately sized red button in the centre of said console.

Floor 4998: you realize that this building can’t possibly be a single building, because you should still be in LKO, or LEO, you can’t remember which. Either way, you see Eeloo out the window. Someone walks up to you and hypnotizes you to forget this fact, however, and you continue on.

floor 4999: you realize that you are not on the better floor one floor above you, and see nothing on this floor

carry on
Floor 5000: It's over 5000!
Floor 5001:AHHHHHHHHHHH I WASNT FAST ENOUGHT!!!!!
5002: Just Kerolon
5003: you see a battle over a hill far below you. It gets more and more ridiculous before resetting. The battle than resumes as you walk up the stairs
5004: This room has a green monolith. When you go up to it, suddenly every space agency has a working SSTO fleet. You think that's weird and continue to the next floor.
5005: This floor is full of poop. Please proceed onward before you die.
5006: Once getting to this floor and seeing what's here, you understand why 5005 was full of poop.
5007: M21 Vulcans. Lots of M21 Vulcans. All pointed at some cephalopod thing. Please move on.
5008: Somebody asks you from darkness: "Did you see a cephalopod thing here? I can't find my pet."
5009: You ride upwards with him. Why would he have that thing as a pet? Why would anyone want that as a pet? Why don't I hear gunfire yet?

5010: He explains that the cephalopod's name was Bunnie, and here lives his mom Pinkie.

Edited November 10, 2018 by kerbiloid
5011: The cephalopod attacks the side of the building. You get sucked out and flung onto the next floor.
5012: You see the Kraken hit Bop at several thousand kilometres per second, before being pulled to the next floor by the USS Enterprise's tractor beam.

Floor 5013: You see me ranting about simple rockets 2

Continue on, no feelings need to be hurt.
Floor 5014: A giant space amoeba.
